content:
We prove that a disjoint filter and ideal in a bounded distributive lattice can always be separated by a prime ideal. This is a step towards establishing Stone duality, currently under development here, but I think it makes sense to separate it out, no pun intended.
It depends on #12651 which @Ruben Van de Velde kindly reviewed, and that one (which was simple & short) is, I think, ready to be merged?
If anyone has time to review #12705 that would be very welcome.

Thanks, I flagged 12651.

Your proof in 12705 seems quite long (though the comments look nice). Is it noticeably slow?
I'm not sure how to best measure that, but when I (naively) add a space at the last line of the file to trigger Lean to re-process the file, it takes less than one second on my machine.
If you have suggestions for a more objective measure I am happy to try it!
set_option trace.profiler true in before the declaration
Sounds like it's not too bad, then

Matthew Ballard said:

set_option trace.profiler true in before the declaration

I get an output that starts with [Elab.command] [0.750001]. I am guessing this means it is taking 0.75s?
Yeah, I get nervous when the first digit after the decimal is not 0 but it certainly not terrible
@Antoine Chambert-Loir kindly had a first pass on this PR and I made some improvements. Is anyone else interested in having a look?
